violations.description: No try-catch block found. DatabaseError, ConnectionError - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch sync errors. NEVER use sync() in production - use migrations instead. sync() can drop and recreate tables - data loss risk.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. ConnectionError, ConnectionRefusedError, HostNotFoundError - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch connection errors. Common causes: wrong credentials, database down, network issues. Implement retry with exponential backoff for transient issues.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. DatabaseError, ConnectionError, TimeoutError - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch query errors. Network errors may be transient and retriable. Invalid query errors should not be retried.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. DatabaseError, ConnectionError, TimeoutError - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch query errors. Returns null if record not found (not an error).

violations.description: No try-catch block found. UniqueConstraintError with fields and error.errors array - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch unique constraint errors. Extract conflicting fields from error.fields. DO NOT retry without changing unique field values.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. DatabaseError, TimeoutError, UniqueConstraintError, etc. - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch transaction errors and handle rollback. Sequelize auto-rollbacks on error in managed transactions. For unmanaged transactions, caller must explicitly rollback. Deadlocks may be transient and retriable.
